{{cpp/container/span/title|operator[]}}
{{cpp/container/span/navbar}}
{{ddcl|since=c++20|1=
constexpr reference operator[]( size_type idx ) const;
}}

Returns a reference to the {{c|idx}}{{sup|th}} element of the sequence. The behavior is undefined if {{c|idx}} is out of range (i.e., if it is greater than or equal to {{lc|size()}}).

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|idx|the index of the element to access}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
A reference to the {{c|idx}}{{sup|th}} element of the sequence, i.e., {{c|data()[idx]}}.

===Exceptions===
Throws nothing.

===Example===
{{example|code=
#include &lt;cstddef&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;span&gt;
#include &lt;utility&gt;

void reverse(std::span&lt;int&gt; span)
{
    for (std::size_t i = 0, j = std::size(span); i &lt; j; ++i)
    {
        --j;
        std::swap(span[i], span[j]);
    }
}

void print(std::span&lt;const int&gt; const span)
{
    for (int element : span)
        std::cout &lt;&lt; element &lt;&lt; ' ';
    std::cout &lt;&lt; '\n';
}

int main()
{
    int data[]{1, 2, 3, 4, 5};
    print(data);
    reverse(data);
    print(data);
}
|output=
1 2 3 4 5
5 4 3 2 1
}}
